title: Governance in the digital age
description: Written by Kent Aitken, Policy Lead at the Digital Academy. It is a comprehensive report written from 300+ interviews as to the state and challenges of digital transformation in government.
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard
author: Kent Aitken

title: Value sensitive design
description: A number of resources and considerations to help ensure that design projects we undertake are ethical, inclusive, reflect on the entire system, including direct and indirect stakeholders.
digitalStandards: Empower employees to deliver better services

title: Old habits die hard (when feelings get in the way)
description: Highlights the difficulty and importance of moving away from personal opinions and to focusing on top user tasks.
author: Celeste Côté

title: Fundamentals of data analysis for government
description: A course targeting government employees that have a qualitative understanding of their work but have yet to master the quantitative skills required to leverage data in their day- to-day responsibilities.
skills: Integrating quantitative and qualitative data anaysis
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard

title: Finding stories in data
description: At the heart of driving change is the skill of finding and telling stories, using where relevant, compelling visualizations.
digitalStandards: Empower employees to deliver better services

title: Introduction to data modelling
description: Go from conceptual to practical as you build your data modelling foundation. Explore data and data design concepts, before you begin sourcing, preparingdesigning and manipulating data.

title: Diseases and immunization optimization project
description: Great example of a web content improvement project based on user needs in the health sector. Includes approach, success metrics, discoveries, visuals.

title: Weaponization of Education Data
description: Thoroughly researched and documented, the author takes you on a journey of the dark side of data. Showing how prolific and devastating data misuse can be.
author: Audrey Watters

title: Content design using data and evidence
description: Explains the difference between writing, editing, copyrighting and digital content design, tells the story of Gov.UK process of converting 75,000 pieces of content into 3,000, explains how to obtain data and evidence to support content design.
author: Sarah Richards

title: Ethics of algorithms: Mapping the debate
description: Overview of the ethical problems introduced by algorithmic decision-making and an attempt to categorize them to better make sense of the types of ethical implications.
author: Brent Daniel Mittelstadt

title: Doing Research with Social Media Data - Ethics
description: Overview of how and why to use social media data to better understand our social context, as well as the ethical implications surrounding this practice.
author: Anatoliy Gruzd

title: Designing for accessibility is not that hard
description: Easy to implement, clear examples with captivating illustrations and a list of helpful tools to support web accessibility.
digitalStandards: Build in accessibility from the start
author: Pablo  Stanley

title: How to Use Airtable for Content Audits, Part 1
description: Excellent break down of how to do a web content audit using an online database tool that helps to visualize and sort through data effectively.
author: Holly Munson

title: Information architecture course
description: Co-designed by government employees with insight into UX and IA contexts of the Government of Canada with many examples to illustrate concepts.
author: Ksenia  Cheinman
organizationalAffiliation: "Canada School of Public Service, CSPS","Canada Revenue Agency, CRA"

title: Open Data 101
description: Describes Canada's open data principles and the importance of open data. Includes a glossary of well-used terms (data, machine readable, open government, open information, etc.).
digitalStandards: Work in the open by default

title: Data Science 101
description: Open, free course for anyone interested in data science.
author: Shingai Manjengwa

title: Fundamental Principles of Analytical Design
description: Patrick Boily, AI/ML professor of the Digital Academy, summarizes Edward Tufte's 2006 article, Fundamental Principles of Analytical Design, and illustrates the principles through health and wealth data visualizations.
author: Patrick Boily

title: AI Practitioners in Government of Canada
description: Research and analysis by GCentrepreneurs on the AI practitioners landscape in the Government of Canada.
digitalStandards: Work in the open by default

title: Why design should include everyone
description: Sinéad Burke is acutely aware of details that are practically invisible to many of us. At 105 centimeters (or 3' 5") tall, the designed world -- from the height of a lock to the range of available shoe sizes -- often inhibits her ability to do things for herself. Here she tells us what it's like to navigate the world as a little person and asks: "Who are we not designing for?"
digitalStandards: Build in accessibility from the start
Empower employees to deliver better services

title: Designing for public services
description: IDEO and Nesta team up to provide advice and create guides on how to design public services.

title: Canada.ca Content Style Guide
description: Here are rules to create web content on Canada.ca content. They are based on writing principles and techniques that help make web content clear and adapted to the needs of all people.

title: Primer to Web Accessibility for Designers
description: Why designers should care about web accessibility and how-to get started.
author: Nicholas Kramer

title: Interviewing humans
description: Excerpt of Erika Hall's book, Just Enough Research, on interviewing people.
author: Erika Hall

title: Ultimate Information Architecture Reading List
description: A reading list to all things related to information architecture.

author: Donna Spencer

title: Beginner's Guide to Rapid Prototyping
description: A beginner's guide to rapid prototyping.

title: Color review
description: A colour tool to ensure use of accessible colours and contrast.

title: Digital Service Standard
description: The Government of Ontario has created a Digital Service Standard that includes 14 points to help anyone build and deliver excellent government services.

title: Practical workshop facilitation skills certificate
description: Gain practical hands-on experience with facilitation.

title: Being Agile in the Ontario Public Service
description: A great introductory overview of Agile principles and methods.

title: Busrides.ca: Agile step-by-step
description: Overview of what the agile methodology is and why it's relevant to us in the public service.

title: Canadian Digi Gov Slack Group
description: A Slack group chat to connect those working in the Canadian digital government space.
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard

description: A Canadian Digital Service Blog by one of their partners, ESDC, and their experience forming a multidisciplinary team.
digitalStandards: Work in the open by default
Empower employees to deliver better services

title: Demystifying data analytics for policy analysts
description: Blog by Anna Wong on her journey learning data and data analysis and its relevance in a policy environment.

author: Anna  Wong

title: Finding Value in Everyday Learnings
description: Blog by Amanda Bernardo on continuous learning outside of formal training and learning means.
digitalStandards: Empower employees to deliver better services
author: Amanda Bernardo

title: Inclusive Design Training Lesson 1: Empathizing
description: Understand empathy, service design, and disability. Playlist 1 of 6 on accessibility.
digitalStandards: Empower employees to deliver better services

title: Digital Accessibility Matters: Creating a More Inclusive Public Service
description: Learn how to use technology and enhance accessibility, and develop policies, legislation, processes and technological solutions to better meet the needs of all users.
digitalStandards: Build in accessibility from the start

title: Lessons Learned After 3 yrs of Experimenting at the CRA
description: The CRA has made experimentation a priority in recent years, and has become a leader in the Government of Canada in advocating for the use of experiments in evidence-based policymaking. That being said, the path towards experimentation hasn’t always been easy, and we’ve learned some lessons over the past few years. We were happy to share these lessons.
skills: Refining a solution based on data

title: Health Data Challenge
description: MaRS seeks to engage innovative Canadians – people and organizations of all backgrounds and skills – to propose and test new data sets, sources and methodologies to solve different health challenges.

title: Design Council Resources
description: A collection of case studies and other materials for innovative policy design.

title: A|B Testing in Government 101
description: Overview of A|B testing in government setting from of a collection of US Government videos available on Youtube via DigitalGov.
organizationalAffiliation: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau,"US Digital Government, DigitalGov"

title: Data Mining for Policymaking
description: Series on data mining in the context of policy.
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard
author: Brooke Struck

title: DigitalGov
description: Digital resources for US government and othersFrom their site: Welcome to DigitalGov. Our mission is to transform how government learns, builds, delivers, and measures digital services in the 21st century. And we do that by providing people in government the tools, methods, practices and policy guidance they need to deliver effective and accessible digital services.
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard

title: Handbook for Participatory Action Research
description: This handbook is an integrated collection of adapted and new tools and processes to engage people and mobilize evidence in complex settings involving multiple stakeholders. They draw inspiration from different disciplines, theoretical perspectives and methodological approaches.
author: Jacques M. Chevalier

title: How to Simulate the Universe in 134 Easy Steps
description: Modeling and simulation and demonstrate how it allows us to learn about a system through play, see how it evolves over time, and understand the underlying mechanism that make it tick.
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard
author: Nicky Case

title: Beginner's Guide to Data Cleaning & Preprocessing
description: How to successfully prepare your data for a machine learning model in minutes.
author: Anne Bonner

title: Problem Framing Expertise in Public Innovation
description: Problem framing practices require high-level expertise, and capability building in public and social innovation should consider these emerging practices and levels of expertise.
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard
author: Mieke van der Bijl-Brouwer

title: 18F Blog Delivering Civic Technology
description: A collection with a service delivery improvement focus that includes lessons learned, modern practices, convincing stakeholders, culture change and product launch topics.
digitalStandards: Build in accessibility from the start

title: Gamestorming
description: Successful creative people tend to employ simple strategies and practices to get where they want to go. It’s not so much that they employ a consistent, repeatable process that leads to consistent creative results. It’s more like a workshop with a set of tools and strategies for examining things deeply, for exploring new ideas, for performing experiments and testing hypotheses, to generate new and surprising insights and results.We have collected the best of these practices wherever we could find them, with a special focus on Silicon Valley, innovative companies, and the information revolution.

title: Innovation Toolkit
description: A multi-disciplinary team of MITRE engineers curated the MITRE Innovation Toolkitto help our colleagues, sponsors, and collaborators jumpstart the innovation process. MITRE is associated with MIT
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard

title: Prototyping in Policy — What For?!
description: Prototypes turn an idea into a form to explore both technical and social feasibility. Whether an idea eventually fails or succeeds, prototyping can help policy-makers, researchers, and others to make the idea more real before investing heavily in it. It helps us sketch, in low-risk and low-resource ways, how a new policy might work. Ideally, it can ‘fail-forward’ or point to better ways to pilot it more robustly. The focus is not on the final outcome (the success or failure), but on the path and its learnings.
author: Verena Kontschieder

title: What's the Role of Design in Policy?
description: The policy-making process is complex and potentially messy, with no ‘right way’. But this very messiness is what might make it particularly suited to design methods.
author: Jasmine Robinson

title: Design Thinking for Complex Environments
description: Nilufer Erdebil's talk on design thinking for problem solving. It provides a good overview of the concepts, Canadian context, pulling back and looking at problem before going straight to solutions, with a focus on empathy, personas and reframing to help understand problem better.
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard
author: Nilufer Erdebil

title: Coalition to Advance Democracy in the Digital Age
description: In countries and communities around the world, defenders of democracy are working to understand and respond to the ways that technology is impacting political and electoral processes. Civil society organizations, grassroots organizers, journalists, civic technologists, political parties, election monitors, fact-checkers, researchers and others are building new tools, developing new analytical models, and implementing local strategies to help navigate accelerating challenges like politically-motivated cyber threats, digital disinformation and computational propaganda. Both globally and regionally, key democracy stakeholders haven’t had a proper channel for information-sharing, research coordination, and advancing shared priorities at the intersection of tech and democracy. So we’re building one, as a community.
skills: Understanding web as a medium and context
Assessing the partiality of online content
author: Kip Wainscott

title: Making it Easier for Policy Makers to do Open Policy
description: This article speaks about the definition of open policy making as being: open to diverse and divergent perspectives; open to the methods you employ to make better policy, and; open to the results from testing. And in many ways, this is what policy makers have always sought to do. However, this article provides us with various tools and ways to practice effective open policy making. Open policy is about harnessing new ways to learn about how policies are experienced and then designing collaboratively with service user
author: Vasant Chari

title: Goodhart’s Law and Why Measurement is Hard
description: This article explains why measures are used. "There are lots of good reasons, and a useful heuristic for understanding where to use them is to look for the triad of intuition, trust, and complexity. Metrics are popular because they allow people to use measures to make rules — and these rules can often be pretty effective. Systems change in response to incentives, and good metrics let us make rules that create the right incentives to improve."
author: David Manheim

title: How Public Policy Can Thrive in a Data World
description: This post brings together ideas on how policy makers can navigate - and thrive - in our digital world. We can do this by better utilising technology and using our "human" attributes to greater advantage; the two not only complement, but enhance each other.
author: Audrey Lobo-Pulo

title: How Computer Software Can Make Policy
description: Piece on the intersection between technology and government and technology's influence on public policy decisions and outcomes.
author: Jennifer Pahlka

title: From Service Design to Systems Change
description: Systems analysis at the ‘front end’ of service design can help us to better understand complex social problems and identify opportunities to respond more effectively and profoundly. Equally, systems thinking provides tools and mindsets to understand the power structures and ‘system immune responses’ which so often kill new solutions before they get off the ground.
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard
author: Adam Groves

title: Twin Faces of Public Sector Design
description: Design thinking does not sufficiently account for the political and organizational contexts of policy work. Design thinking also errs in universally privileging one particular policy style over others, and fails to account for the reality of policy mixes. Despite these deficiencies, it is argued that design thinking can inform and enrich governance by helping policy designers produce more adaptable designs, better appreciate the behavioral dynamics of public sector design, and leverage networked approaches to social problem solving.
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard
author: Jonathan Craft
organizationalAffiliation: "Governance - An International Journal of Policy, Administration, and Institutions"

title: Making Public Policy in the Digital Age
description: Modern design and development practices mean it is possible to prototype totally new services and iterate existing ones quickly. Teams working on digital services can test with the public in near real-time. Insights that once took years to emerge can be uncovered in days or weeks.
digitalStandards: Empower employees to deliver better services
author: Richard Pope

title: Tools and Discipline of Data Storytelling
description: Data storytelling is usually made up of multiple data visualisations, connected through narrative. Effective data storytelling requires tools capable of visualising data and communicating narrative.
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard
author: Kat Greenbrook

title: From Research Labs to Data Training, Here's How to Bring Evidence into Policy
description: A critique of the relationship between research, evidence, and policy in Canada, and suggestions for how to work better together.
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard
author: Jennifer Guay

title: In the Dark: The Cost of Canada’s Data Deficit
description: When it comes to basic data about its own citizens – from divorce rates to driving patterns to labour trends – Canada simply doesn’t have the answers. If information is power, this country has a big problem
author: Eric Andrew-Gee

title: Behavioural Insights Team
description: We generate and apply behavioural insights to inform policy, improve public services, and deliver positive results for people and communities.
skills: Refining a solution based on data

title: Five Models for Making Sense of Complex Systems
description: The five models are exploratory/conceptual or declarative/conceptual models (or maps or diagrams.) That means they are based in ideas, not data. These five diagrams are particularly useful for understanding complex systems. This seems more important every day, as we are all complexifying things full time
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard
author: Christina Wodtke

title: Digital Government Atlas: Best Resources
description: A collection with these categories of resources: Digital government guidesDigital standardsGovernment GitHubsOpen source resourcesTools/toolkitsOpen data resourcesOpen data setsData visualisation
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard

title: Policy Impact Fundamentals Framework - Diagnostic Tool
description: The Public Impact Fundamentals diagnostic tool was designed to help you improve the impact of a government initiative by assessing whether the key drivers of policy success are in place.
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard

title: 7 Lenses Maturity Matrix
description: The 7 Lenses maturity matrix is a practical tool to help teams reflect on their transformation, have focused discussions, and identify which areas need more attention. The matrix was the result of extensive collaboration between colleagues across government, and the team have shared their experience of developing and using the tool.
author: Mark Osborne

title: Qualitative Analysis Digs Deep into Community Engagement
description: Qualitative data analysis brings community voices and experiences to planners looking to understand how people feel about issues. While this can be hugely valuable it is tricky to unpack, particularly with the open field questions associated with it. But qualitative analysis can help tell more of the story, answering important questions
skills: Integrating quantitative and qualitative data anaysis
author: Sally Hussey

title: New Data Science Cheat Sheet
description: A reference in data science that covers basic concepts in probability, statistics, statistical learning, machine learning, deep learning, big data frameworks and SQL.
author: Maverick Lin

title: Bringing Together Policy and Digital Delivery
description: Within the Canadian government, there’s a growing movement to bring more traditional policy work into the digital era. This article speaks on why you should have a policy team within a digital delivery shop, and what it takes to be an effective policy person within a delivery team.
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard

title: Open Policy Making Toolkit
description: The manual includes information about Open Policy Making as well as the tools and techniques policy makers can use to create more open and user-led policy.
digitalStandards: Work in the open by default

title: Data Camp
description: Learn Data Science Online. The skills people and businesses need to succeed are changing. No matter where you are in your career or what field you work in, you will need to understand the language of data.
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard

title: Delivery-driven Government
description: This article speaks about the importance of developing policy around a deep understanding of the needs of its intended beneficiaries, and increases ongoing situational awareness.
digitalStandards: Empower employees to deliver better services
author: Jennifer Pahlka

title: How Collective Intelligence Can Change our World
description: This article focuses on the definition of intelligence and the way it has been shaped and altered through time to reflect the changes of society and human behaviour. It touches on the type of support available for teams and groups working to address complex issues across a variety of organizational and societal contexts. Because of the greater diversity in this world, it creates a need for greater collective intelligence and synthesis. The focus of the article explores the question: How can collective intelligence arise?
digitalStandards: Empower employees to deliver better services
author: Michael Hogan

title: What is User Experience (UX) Design?
description: A brief video introduction to UX design and its history + a short article clarifying terminology and offering further reading suggestions.

title: Massive Codesign: A Proposal for a Collaborative Design Framework
description: Given the GoC's need for diversity and diverse perspectives, this could inform the way we co-design with more stakeholders to create more diverse data to inform policy making.
author: Anna Meroni

title: Data Skills for Public Servants: Where to Learn for Free
description: From leadership and communication to data and digital, this collection of these courses and resources will get you where you need to.
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard

title: Democratization of Data Science
description: These days every industry is drenched in data, and the organizations that succeed are those that most quickly make sense of their data in order to adapt to what’s coming. The best way to enable fast discovery and deeper insights is to disperse data science expertise across an organization.
author: Jonathan Cornelissen

title: Mapping the "Design" Discipline to Build a Learning Architecture
description: This post looks at 9 discipline maps for each of the learning streams that focus on the development of digital skills in the public service. The main purpose of these maps would be to serve as the taxonomic backbone (think faceted/ parametric search/ filters to help you find and discover content) of the Digital Open Learning platform that was being developed at the same time.
digitalStandards: Work in the open by default
author: Ksenia  Cheinman

title: New Practice of Public Problem Solving
description: "A new class of innovators is advancing the public good by figuring out what people actually need and then testing, improving, and scaling solutions that may already be out there."
author: Tara McGuinness

title: Introduction to GBA+
description: "Gender-based Analysis Plus (GBA+) is an analytical process used to assess how diverse groups of women, men and non-binary people may experience policies, programs and initiatives. GBA+ also considers many other identity factors, such as race, ethnicity, religion, age, and mental or physical disability."
digitalStandards: Build in accessibility from the start

title: Abuse My Data, Just Do it Right
description: Great, short opinion piece on data use and ethics with a number of important questions to ask ourselves in the process.
author: Emilie Colker

title: Key pillar of our digital future: Tell Us Once
description: Easy to watch video that tells the "opportunity" story of public service modernization.

title: Changing mindsets by breaking silos
description: An article about changing mindsets through logic rather than methodologies, by breaking silos, and bringing in UX practitioners.
digitalStandards: Empower employees to deliver better services
author: Heidi Uchiyama

title: A|B Testing in Government 102
description: Overview of A|B testing in government setting from of a collection of US Government videos available on Youtube via DigitalGov.
organizationalAffiliation: "US Digital Government, DigitalGov",Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

title: Let’s write more blog posts: an experiment
description: An excellent strategy to share work in the open and learn from others via pair-writing.
digitalStandards: Work in the open by default
author: Amy Hupe

title: De-risking custom technology projects - A handbook for state budgeting and oversight
description: A handbook that walks you through how to minimize risk in technology projects, including Agile methods, human-centred design, and DevOps.
skills: Integrating technical and human-centred design practices
digitalStandards: Build in accessibility from the start

title: Examples of "AI" use in government/public administration/public services (Responses)
description: An evergreen source of AI use cases across government. A non-profit organization Centre for Public Impact invited government organizations to share examples of AI use in the government. The spreadsheet includes description and link to  a project, government organization using AI and the methods used.
skills: Integrating technical and human-centred design practices

title: Co-walking, l’alternative à la réunion
Faciliter les conversations avec les citoyens dans la ville bilingue de Moncton
description: "Nicole Melanson, Gestionnaire, Communications et services bilingues, à la Ville de Moncton, discutent comment une plateforme d’engagement numérique a permis de créer une expérience de participation citoyenne intéressante dans une communauté bilingue."
digitalStandards: Work in the open by default
author: Nicole Melanson

title: Queer in the Design Industry
description: This article shares data about inclusion of the LGBTQ+ community in the Design industry and describes some of the barriers they experience.
digitalStandards: Build in accessibility from the start
author: John Warren Hanawalt

title: Intersectionality Toolkit
description: Excellent resources to consider our personal biases, become more self-reflective, connect with others and discover where we are positioned in the space of privilege.
digitalStandards: Build in accessibility from the start
organizationalAffiliation: "Canadian Research Institute for the Advancement of Women, CRIAW",Iglyo

title: What Does “Queering Design Education” Actually Look Like in Practice?
digitalStandards: Build in accessibility from the start

title: Data Science, le guide de survie complet
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard

title: Sécurité informatique, exemples et applications
description: "Présentation des nouvelles approches de la sécurité et le numérique au travers d’exemples : le document numérique (sa fiabilité, sa protection), la vidéo-surveillance (l’analyse automatique de comportement) et les communications sans fil (leur fiabilité et leur robustesse)."

title: Celui qui avait fait son coming-out
description: "Jean-Baptiste a 27 ans et est homosexuel. Depuis qu’il est “out” dans sa vie personnelle et professionnelle, il a décidé d’être dans l’échange et la pédagogie tant sur les réseaux sociaux qu’auprès de ses collègues. Pour lui, il n’y a pas d’homophobie ordinaire. Il n’y a que de l’homophobie qu’il se fait un devoir de combattre et de dénoncer jusque dans l’open-space."
digitalStandards: Build in accessibility from the start

title: Celle qui a fait un burn-out
description: "Louisa ne veut pas lâcher l’affaire, elle aime son travail et lui donne tout. Tout, jusqu’à sa santé. Après plusieurs mois à ignorer les signaux, son corps lâche. C’est le burn-out. Comment se sortir de cette mauvaise passe, remonter la pente et retrouver l’envie de se lever et d’aller travailler chaque matin ? Comment accepter sans culpabiliser ? Et surtout, comment et à qui en parler pour se faire aider ?"
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard

title: Karen McGrane podcast interview: adapting to change through
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard

title: Enjeux éthiques du Big Data : opportunités et risques
description: "Ce qui s'appelle le Big Data, appliqué à la Santé, devrait ouvrir de nouvelles perspectives pour la recherche médicale, le suivi des pathologies et l’amélioration des soins. Mais au-delà des opportunités, que devient la relation patient-praticien ? Quels sont les risques liés à la sauvegarde des données ? Comment faire face aux enjeux liés à l’accessibilité et à l’exploitation des données de patients ?"

title: Femmes immigrantes et réfugiées
description: "Seulement 4% de tous les Canadiens et Canadiennes ne sont pas des personnes immigrantes ou descendantes d'immigrants. En fait, les peuples autochtones sont les seuls à être nés dans ce pays où ils vivent depuis 10 000 ans. Les Canadiennes venues d'ailleurs représentent 30% de la population féminine totale et leur nombre augmentre quatre fois plus vite que celui des femmes nées au Canada."
author: Marika Morris
organizationalAffiliation: "Canadian Research Institute for the Advancement of Women, CRIAW"

title: Livre en français pour tout savoir sur le test utilisateur
description: "Vous cherchez à mieux intégrer le test dans votre processus de conception ? Vous trouverez 80 pages dédiées à l’explication détaillée des différentes méthodologies de test dans un projet web. On découvre notamment qu’il existe différents protocoles de test utilisateur qui peuvent être menés dès les prémices du projet jusqu’à son aboutissement."

title: Découvrir le design public
description:
"Vous souhaitez découvrir comment mener vos projets différemment ? Voici les principales méthodes de la gestion de projets publics en mode design. Suivez le guide !"

"

title: VISUALISATION DE DONNÉES ET PROCESSUS DE SYNTHÈSE
description: "Grâce à l’analyse de différentes représentations graphiques réalisées par des étudiants, cet article se propose d’étudier le lien entre visualisation de données et capacité de synthèse, mais aussi la convergence entre le processus créatif induit par la visualisation de données et le processus de synthèse. Cette étude conclut que le processus créatif lié à la visualisation de données exige des étudiants qu’ils fassent appel à des stratégies de pensée critique, à leurs expériences passées, à leurs connaissances dans différents domaines et à leur capacité à « découper en fines tranches », décoder et comprendre les images visuelles."
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard
author: Yichien Cooper

title: PDF ET ACCESSIBILITÉ : LA FAUSSE BONNE IDÉE
skills: Understanding web as a medium and context
digitalStandards: Build in accessibility from the start
author: Sylvie Duchateau

title: Content + UX slack group
description: "Content + UX is a community of professionals celebrating content strategy, content itself, and its role in the user experience."
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard

title: Réunir la prestation de services numériques et les politiques
description: Within the Canadian government, there’s a growing movement to bring more traditional policy work into the digital era. This article speaks on why you should have a policy team within a digital delivery shop, and what it takes to be an effective policy person within a delivery team.
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard

title: Architecture de l’information
description: Co-designed by government employees with insight into UX and IA contexts of the Government of Canada with many examples to illustrate concepts.
author: Ksenia  Cheinman
organizationalAffiliation: "Canada School of Public Service, CSPS","Canada Revenue Agency, CRA"

title: CREATION OF DATA VISUALIZATION AND SYNTHESIZING PROCESS
description: "Examining samples of data visualizations made by college students, this paper will investigate the relationship between the creation of data visualization and synthesizing skills, as well as address how the creative process of data visualization coincides with synthesis. This study finds that the process of making a data visualization requires students to utilize their critical thinking strategies, prior experience, knowledge across curricula, and abilities to thin- slice, decode, and comprehend visual images.?
digitalStandards: Not directly applicable to any standard
author: Yichien Cooper

title: Immigrant and Refugee Women
description: "Only 4% of Canadians are not immigrants or descendents of immigrants. Only Aboriginal peoples are native to this land, and have lived and died here for 10,000 years. Thirty percent of Canadian women have themselves immigrated here from somewhere else and this population is growing four times faster than the population of Canadian-born women."
author: Marika Morris
organizationalAffiliation: "Canadian Research Institute for the Advancement of Women, CRIAW"

title: Être agile dans la fonction publique de l’Ontario
description: A great introductory overview of Agile principles and methods.

title: Introduction à l'ACS+
description: "L’analyse comparative entre les sexes plus (ACS+) sert à évaluer les répercussions potentielles des politiques, des programmes ou des initiatives sur divers ensembles de personnes — femmes, hommes ou autres. L’identité individuelle est déterminée par une multitude de facteurs en plus du sexe, par exemple la race, l’origine ethnique, la religion, l’âge ou le fait de vivre avec un handicap de nature physique ou intellectuelle. D’où l’ajout du mot « plus », signifiant que l’analyse ne se limite pas au sexe (différences biologiques) ou au genre (la construction sociale du sexe), mais considère aussi les autres facteurs qui les recoupent."
digitalStandards: Build in accessibility from the start

title: À la base de notre avenir numérique : Une fois suffit
description: Easy to watch video that tells the "opportunity" story of public service modernization.

title: Facilitating Public Conversations in the Bilingual Community of Moncton
description: "Nicole Melanson, Manager, Communications and Bilingual Services at the City of Moncton, sit down to discuss how a digital engagement platform has made public participation across a multilingual community a seamless endeavor."
digitalStandards: Work in the open by default
author: Nicole Melanson
